alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 5:52PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Camden, southeastern Pasquotank and southeastern Currituck Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Point Harbor to near Mashoes. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sanderling and Point Harbor around 555 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bob White Fork, Spot, Listers Corner, Glen Cove, Harbinger, Jarvisburg, Frog Island, Powells Point, Texas and Bertha. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Western Currituck
